customer_addr:
N13653 COUNTY ROAD M
THORP, WI 54771

citations.narrative:
The facility is conducting regulated activity without a license from USDA APHIS Animal Care under the Animal Welfare
Act (AWA). On May 10, 2025, a search was conducted by a USDA inspector. A parakeet, two puppies (3.5 months old),
and 8 kittens (approximately 6 weeks old) were being sold (the kittens were listed as "Free Kittens"). The customer no
longer holds a USDA license. Conducting regulated activity without a USDA license does not allow for the inspection of
the regulated animals' health and well-being in accordance with the Animal Welfare Act. Continuing to conduct regulated
activity without a license is a serious violation of the Animal Welfare Act. The customer must either stop selling regulated
animals at the animal auction or the customer must obtain a USDA license.
NO REGULATED ACTIVITIES MAY BE CONDUCTED UNTIL A LICENSE IS OBTAINED.

citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats.
citations.narrative:
Two 3.5 month old cockapoo puppies were housed in a wire crate enclosure that measured 17.5'' by 23.75''. The puppies
were not able to lie in a natural position where they could fully extend themselves. The one puppy was observed to be
resting its head on the other puppy during inspection as there wasn't sufficient space to rest their heads on their paws or
on the floor of the enclosure. This does not provide for the comfort and well being of the dogs. Dogs offered for sale at the
auction must be provided adequate space. Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs must be large enough to
ensure that each animal contained in the primary enclosure has enough space to turn about normally while standing, to
stand and sit erect, and to lie in a natural position.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.1(a)(1) 
   
Requirements and application. 
The facility is conducting regulated activity without a license from USDA APHIS Animal Care under the Animal Welfare 
Act (AWA). On May 10, 2025, a search was conducted by a USDA inspector. A parakeet, two puppies (3.5 months old), 
and 8 kittens (approximately 6 weeks old) were being sold (the kittens were listed as "Free Kittens"). The customer no 
longer holds a USDA license. Conducting regulated activity without a USDA license does not allow for the inspection of 
the regulated animals' health and well-being in accordance with the Animal Welfare Act. Continuing to conduct regulated 
activity without a license is a serious violation of the Animal Welfare Act. The customer must either stop selling regulated 
animals at the animal auction or the customer must obtain a USDA license. 
 
NO REGULATED ACTIVITIES MAY BE CONDUCTED UNTIL A LICENSE IS OBTAINED. 
3.15(e)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats. 
Two 3.5 month old cockapoo puppies were housed in a wire crate enclosure that measured 17.5'' by 23.75''. The puppies 
were not able to lie in a natural position where they could fully extend themselves. The one puppy was observed to be 
resting its head on the other puppy during inspection as there wasn't sufficient space to rest their heads on their paws or 
on the floor of the enclosure. This does not provide for the comfort and well being of the dogs. Dogs offered for sale at the 
auction must be provided adequate space. Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs must be large enough to 
ensure that each animal contained in the primary enclosure has enough space to turn about normally while standing, to 
stand and sit erect, and to lie in a natural position. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
